member.summary:
Creates a deployment.
These fields are mandatory: `name` `project_name` `assembly_id` `starting_snapshot_id` `launch_config`
In addition, these fields are optional: `region_code` `cluster_code` `tag`
The returned operation result is of type `deployment`.

The initial metadata to send with the call. This parameter is optional.
An optional deadline for the call. The call will be cancelled if deadline is hit.
An optional token for canceling the call.

member.summary: Field number for the "deployment_id" field.

member.summary: The UUID of the deployment that the user will get access to.

member.summary: Field number for the "lifetime_duration" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreateLoginTokenRequest.LifetimeDuration
member.summary:
Specifies how long the LT will be valid for.
This field is optional. When unspecified, this will default to 15 minutes (maximum value is 30 minutes).

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreateLoginTokenRequest.WorkerTypeFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "worker_type" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreateLoginTokenRequest.WorkerType
member.summary:
The worker type that the user will be allowed to connect to the deployment as.
This field is optional - empty string is allowed by validator. If not specified, the worker type provided by Worker SDK when connecting to the deployment will be used. This regular expression needs to be kept compatible with the regex located on the worker_type field in proto/improbable/ext/cli/project/project_configuration.proto.

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreateLoginTokenResponse.LoginTokenFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "login_token" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreateLoginTokenResponse.LoginToken
member.summary: The login_token is a short lived token (up to 15 minutes), allowing the user to log in to a deployment with the specified name. It is a signed JWT with the following claims: sub: provider-scoped unique user ID. Corresponds to the player_identifier supplied in CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest. prvdr: describes system used to authenticate the user. Corresponds to provider in CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest. prj: project that the token is scoped to. dpl: deployment UUID that the token gives access to. iat: issued at time is the time at which the token was issued This is the time since epoch in seconds in UTC. exp: expiry time. This is the time since epoch in seconds in UTC. wkt: worker type: This is the worker type that the user will be allowed to connect to the deployment as.

member.name: T:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest
member.summary:
The following fields are mandatory: - `provider` - `player_identifier` - `project_name`
The remaining fields are optional: - `lifetime_duration`. If provided, this must be a positive duration, less or equal to 24. - `metadata`. If provided, this must be less than or equal to 256 bytes.

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.ProviderFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "provider" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.Provider
member.summary: The system used to authenticate the player with e.g. Steam, Google A provider name containing 'improbable' (case insensitive) will not be accepted as this is reserved for internal use.

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.PlayerIdentifierFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "player_identifier" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.PlayerIdentifier
member.summary:
The ID of the player for which we are generating a PIT.
This should uniquely identify a user in the specified provider.

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.ProjectNameFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "project_name" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.ProjectName
member.summary: The project that the PIT is scoped to. This should be between 3 and 32 characters and made up of lower case letters, numbers and underscores only.

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.LifetimeDurationFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "lifetime_duration" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.LifetimeDuration
member.summary:
The duration for which the issued PIT will be valid.
It must be set to less than 24 hours.
This field is optional. If unset or 0, it defaults to 24 hours.

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.DisplayNameFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "display_name" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.DisplayName
member.summary:
The player's display name. This field is optional.
The display name is controlled by the caller and may contain personal information. It should not be stored or logged.

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.MetadataFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "metadata" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest.Metadata
member.summary:
Additional metadata that is stored within the PIT.
You can use this to securely attach extra attributes on the PIT in a format you choose. eg: JSON payload: bytes("{ 'userType': 'PREMIUM', 'region': 'EU' }") It must use less than or equal to 256 bytes. Exceeding this limitation will result in an `InvalidArgument` error.
This field is optional.

member.name: F:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenResponse.PlayerIdentityTokenFieldNumber
member.summary: Field number for the "player_identity_token" field.

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.PlayerAuth.V2Alpha1.CreatePlayerIdentityTokenResponse.PlayerIdentityToken
member.summary:
The player_identity_token is a long lived token (up to 24h) which guarantees a user's identity in the context of a project
It is a signed JWT with the following payload: sub: provider-scoped unique user ID. Corresponds to the player_identifier supplied in CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest. prvdr: describes system used to authenticate the user. Corresponds to provider in CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest. prj: project that the PIT is scoped to. md: metadata. Corresponds to md in CreatePlayerIdentityTokenRequest. iat: issued at time. This is the time since epoch in seconds in UTC. exp: expiry time. This is the time since epoch in seconds in UTC. dn: display name. This is an optional user provided string, corresponding to display name in the CreatePlayerIdentityRequest

No status codes

member.name: M:Improbable.SpatialOS.Snapshot.V1Alpha1.SnapshotService.SnapshotServiceBase.ListSnapshots(Improbable.SpatialOS.Snapshot.V1Alpha1.ListSnapshotsRequest,Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext)
member.summary:
List a deployment's snapshots.
The following fields are mandatory: - `project_name` - `deployment_name`
`project_name` must conform to the regex: ^[a-z0-9_]{3,32}$ `deployment_name` must conform to the regex: ^[a-z0-9_]{3,32}$
The remaining fields are optional: - If provided, the `page_size` must be a positive integer. If omitted, the default value of 20 is used. - The `page_token` should be omitted in the first request. If the response contains a page token, this token should be included in the next request, and so on until a response is received with no page token.
Snapshots are sorted by creation time, descending.
member.param: The request received from the client.
The context of the server-side call handler being invoked.
member.returns: The response to send back to the client (wrapped by a task).

member.name: M:Improbable.SpatialOS.Snapshot.V1Alpha1.SnapshotService.SnapshotServiceBase.GetSnapshot(Improbable.SpatialOS.Snapshot.V1Alpha1.GetSnapshotRequest,Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext)
member.summary:
Get the details of a specific snapshot.
These fields are mandatory: - `project_name` - `deployment_name` - `id`
`project_name` must conform to the regex: ^[a-z0-9_]{3,32}$ `deployment_name` must conform to the regex: ^[a-z0-9_]{3,32}$ `id` must be a 64-bit integer.
Empty or invalid fields result in an `InvalidArgument` error.
member.param: The request received from the client.
The context of the server-side call handler being invoked.
member.returns: The response to send back to the client (wrapped by a task).

member.name: M:Improbable.SpatialOS.Snapshot.V1Alpha1.SnapshotService.SnapshotServiceBase.TakeSnapshot(Improbable.SpatialOS.Snapshot.V1Alpha1.TakeSnapshotRequest,Grpc.Core.ServerCallContext)
member.summary:
Take a snapshot of a running deployment.
Currently, you can only supply these fields: - `project_name` - `deployment_name` - `tags`
Other set values will be ignored.
In addition, these fields are mandatory: - `project_name` - `deployment_name`
`project_name` must conform to the regex: ^[a-z0-9_]{3,32}$ `deployment_name` must conform to the regex: ^[a-z0-9_]{3,32}$
Failure to set either of these will result in an `InvalidArgument` error.
The returned operation result is of type `snapshot`.
member.param: The request received from the client.
The context of the server-side call handler being invoked.
member.returns: The response to send back to the client (wrapped by a task).

member.summary:
Upload a new snapshot (returns a URL to upload its contents to).
Currently, you can only supply these fields: - `project_name` - `deployment_name` - `tags` - `checksum`
Other set values will be ignored.
In addition, these fields are mandatory: - `project_name` - `deployment_name` - `checksum`
`project_name` must conform to the regex: ^[a-z0-9_]{3,32}$ `deployment_name` must conform to the regex: ^[a-z0-9_]{3,32}$
Failure to set any of these will result in an `InvalidArgument` error.
member.param: The request received from the client.
The context of the server-side call handler being invoked.
member.returns: The response to send back to the client (wrapped by a task).

member.name: P:Improbable.SpatialOS.Platform.Common.PlatformRefreshTokenCredential.AutoDetected
member.summary: Gets an instance of the class by retrieving the locally stored refresh token from a file. It tries to determine the path to the refresh token in the following order: 1. use the environment variable `SPATIALOS_REFRESH_TOKEN_FILE` 2. use the same well-known location `spatial` CLI tool uses, e.g. `$HOME/.improbable/oauth2/oauth2_refresh_token` on a Mac; Note: invoking `spatial init` creates the refresh token file in the well-known location.
member.exception: Thrown when no refresh token is found in the specified location or the well-known location.

member.name: P:Validator.FieldValidator.FloatEpsilon
member.summary: Field value of double describing the epsilon within which any comparison should be considered to be true. For example, when using float_gt = 0.35, using a float_epsilon of 0.05 would mean that any value above 0.30 is acceptable. It can be thought of as a {float_value_condition} +- {float_epsilon}. If unset, no correction for floating point inaccuracies in comparisons will be attempted.
